intro: Pseudognaphalium crenatum, commonly known as the roughleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Pseudognaphalium crenatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
